alert.note: Alert for Hamlin (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 2:02PM MDT until May 05 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. Pelican Lake near Watertown affecting Codington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River Near Castlewood. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water overtops the culvert on 184th Street and significant agricultural flooding begins north of Castlewood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Friday morning and continue falling to 8.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday.
